sudo apt-get install lm-sensors
sudo sensors-detect

Copy and paste both of those commands, when the 2nd command asks type YES until you have to hit Enter. Alternatively could try adding -y at the end. After that go into the apps preferences and enable on startup.
At least one thing done.

description:
I have the apparently common problem that it says no active sensors. there is nothing in the preferences dialogue to get things working. Why in this latest ubuntu version is there so little choice of software, there is only one option for temperature monitoring and it does not work for me. 
Early versions of Ubuntu had loads of choice, not anymore
basic app, would need to be refined a bit, but works well

After recent 18.04.3 LTS update it stopped working. It worked OK for months after initial install, but did not give complete data. Asus Prime B450M-A/CSM AMD Ryzen 2 AM4 DDR4 motherboard, AMD Ryzen 5 2400G, 16G RAM, Kingston 480G SDD.

I installed this indicator on an MSI Apache Pro GE62 6QD with the latest NVidia Proprietary drivers installed. I also have lm-sensors installed and I was looking for a way to show the temperatures in my top bar. 

The temperature for my GTX 960M, my CPU package temp and each core's temperature show up properly. It works great so far!
installed so quick. just went into prefs and selected my temps.

c'est quoi ces daubes qui trainent et qui nous font perdre notre temps
Pas evident de lui faire trouver des capteur, puis ne les active pas,

...avant de faire un commentaire révélant votre perspicacité: la ligne d'état du bureau affiche une nouvelle indication en haut à droite: "Aucun Capteur activé". Cliquer sur cette indication, un menu apparaît. Choisir "Préférences". En "Général", tableau "Capteur", plusieurs (2?) points d'entrée: cliquer sur le triangle et choisir sous chaque point d'entrée les capteurs à surveiller. Un double clic sur chacun de ceux-ci permet de définir des alertes :-)
Cétou.
